extendedInfo.description: *Important Note*: Thank you all for your incredible support. We are taking the OsciPrime Oscilloscope one step further. The new application on the market ( http://goo.gl/UhgYf ) will have all the features plus new multi touch support and is also available as Open Source under http://www.osciprime.com .This is the Open Source Oscilloscope based on the Bachelor Thesis "Using Android in Industrial Automation" of the University of Applied Sciences of Northwestern Switzerland.Note that this application is written for an embedded system for high speed data acquisition (runs on the Beagleboard) and this is a port to the phone/tablet platform.It will use the microphone as input source, "USB" will only work with the hardware board from our project.For more information about the project visithttp://android.serverbox.chFeatures:-> (NEW) Tablet support-> Mic Input, only working mono 44100[Hz] at the moment.-> Cursor, Trigger, Offset-> If you want to use it with our board (schematic at http://android.serverbox.ch) up to dual 6 [Msps], 8 bit A/D, no root needed :).Important Note:Tested on Nexus S, HTC Magic, LG P500 and Acer A500 3.1 TabIf you want to add your own features feel free to download the and compile the source: http://android.serverbox.ch/?p=268

reviews.title: Nifty
reviews.comment: Took me a while to figure out how to turn it on.  To display audio waveform via microphone:  Menu, [ S ], Source Selection: Audio
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: Good, but confusing.
reviews.author: Justin Zuber

reviews.title: Gfggfg
reviews.comment: Wtf,didnt even have time to figure how that work if it work.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Good job
reviews.author: scott turner

reviews.title: great idea
reviews.comment: It seems amazing to have so much in one place,good luck with the hardware.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Decent oscilloscope!
reviews.comment: I got this as my school\'s CRO was damaged and I needed to teach a lesson on sound waves. Needless to say it does its job well but it would be good if you could change background colour for higher contrast.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great teaching aid.
reviews.comment: I used this to illustrate to my six year old that sounds are waves.  Thank you.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great. Thanks
reviews.comment: Great.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: love it
reviews.comment: Thanks a lot!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Impressed
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cool but need improvement
reviews.comment: Missing the most essential feature of showing the frequency/division. Impossible to know what I am actually measuring. The \"t:340\" label is not help either. Second: A great idea is to build a frequency down-converter probe so we can measure more than 22 KHz with audio port!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Expert electronics tech thanks u
reviews.comment: Will investigate your board offering, nice audio input feature. Works well on Samsung Galaxy S II
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Really nice start to a good app. Needs some improvement, better time division selection, a multimeter mode, a one shot trigger, stereo audio input.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Works well on wildfire s. Good basic audio oscillo. Some documentation would be nice...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome first step!
reviews.comment: I\'m an EE and have been waiting for an app like this. It showcases what is possible but needs the ability to trigger and change scales.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pointless
reviews.comment: I guess with time this could be a great little app.  As it stands though it is completely pointless.  No units, scale, or clue.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Built an isolated circuit for use with the headphone Jack on my optimus v, works well! Only compliaint is the timebase and inability to record data
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Would be better if you could change the timebase and the gain manually, but otherwise works well. I might make a little circuit so I can probe. HD2
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Look forward to seeing this develope. BF.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Tried on Galaxy S
reviews.comment: Samples audio but no obvious controls eg timebase, no instruction list
reviews.author: A Google User
